P5Bezier.name: p5.bezier
P5Bezier.description: a p5.js library engineered to assist you in creating Bézier curves. It is an enhancement of the original p5.js bezier() function, extending its capabilities beyond the limitation of four control points.

P5Anaglyph.name: p5.anaglyph
P5Anaglyph.description: Library for creating 3D (anaglyph) scenes and images using red/cyan glasses. Uses Dubois anaglyph algorithm & color matrices.

P5Grain.name: p5.grain
P5Grain.description: a p5.js addon for conveniently applying grain and texture overlays to artworks.

P5Dom.name: p5.dom
P5Dom.description: Provides tools to interact with HTML elements like sliders, buttons, and inputs within p5.js sketches.

P5Sound.name: p5.sound
P5Sound.description: Adds sound synthesis and audio analysis capabilities to p5.js sketches.

P5Grid.name: p5Grid
P5Grid.description: An implementation of highly flexible triangle, square, hexagon, and octagon girds for p5.js.

C2Js.name: c2.js
C2Js.description: c2.js is a JavaScript library for creative coding based on computational geometry, physics simulation, evolutionary algorithms, and other modules.

P5Brush.name: p5.brush
P5Brush.description: extend the drawing capabilities of p5.js by introducing a rich set of tools that allow for the creation of dynamic and customizable brushes, vector-fields, and fill modes

P5FillGradient.name: p5.fillGradient
P5FillGradient.description: Fill shapes in p5.js with Linear, Radial and Conic Gradients. p5.fillGradient enables shape filling with Linear, Radial and Conic Gradients instead of plain colours in your p5.js sketch.

Assimp.name: Assimp
Assimp.description: Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

VideoExport.name: VideoExport
VideoExport.description: Allows exporting videos from Processing sketches using FFMPEG.

Geomerative.name: Geomerative
Geomerative.description: Accesses vertex points of vector graphics or text for manipulation.

Ani.name: Ani
Ani.description: A library for animating parameters in sketches.

Queasycam.name: Queasycame
Queasycam.description: Provides first-person camera controls in 3D spaces.

Nub.name: nub
Nub.description: a simple, expressive, language-agnostic, and extensible visual computing library, featuring interaction, visualization and animation frameworks and supporting advanced (onscreen/offscreen) rendering techniques

ControlP5.name: ControlP5
ControlP5.description: A versatile UI library for creating buttons, sliders, and knobs.

GifAnimation.name: GifAnimation
GifAnimation.description: Enables exporting animated GIFs from sketches.

Tramontana.name: Tramontana
Tramontana.description: Provides access to phone sensors for AR/VR-like interactions.

OscP5.name: OscP5
OscP5.description: Facilitates Open Sound Control (OSC) communication with external devices.

SonicPi.name: Sonic Pi
SonicPi.description: free code-based music creation and performance tool

Overtone.name: Overtone
Overtone.description: open source audio environment designed to explore new musical ideas from synthesis and sampling to instrument building, live-coding and collaborative jamming.

TidalCycles.name: TidalCycles
TidalCycles.description: live coding language embedded in Haskell, ideal for rhythm-based music and pattern generation
